title: Cursor 2.2: Debug Mode, Visual Editor, and Multi-Agent Improvements
description: Cursor 2.2 (released December 10, 2025) introduces Debug Mode for automatic bug detection and fixing with runtime logs, Visual Editor for drag-and-drop web design in Cursor Browser, Plan Mode with Mermaid diagram integration, and enhanced multi-agent capabilities with better context selection and token efficiency.

community_feedback.quote: Described as '炸裂发布' (explosive release) with Debug Mode being called a game-changer for fixing '疑难杂症' (difficult problems)
While features are praised, some developers mention concerns about bugs and an ever-changing UI being irksome

title: Copilot Memory Feature - Early Access
description: GitHub announced Copilot Memory in early access on December 19, 2025, for Pro and Pro+ subscribers. This feature enables persistent context across sessions, allowing Copilot to remember codebase patterns and user preferences, solving the 'Groundhog Day problem' of forgetting context between sessions.

community_feedback.quote: Users have developed workarounds for Copilot forgetting context between sessions, indicating strong demand for persistent memory
Previous discussions highlighted 'Copilot has memory problems where you ask it to save something and next session it's gone again'

title: Copilot Code Review Preview for Enterprise Cloud with Data Residency
description: GitHub announced on December 18, 2025, that Copilot code review preview features are now supported in GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency requirements, enabling enterprise customers with strict data governance to access AI-powered code review capabilities.

title: Expanded Codemaps with Chat Integration and Cascade Improvements
description: Version 1.12.28 (November 3, 2025) brings expanded Codemaps with 'Chat with map' for direct interaction with codebase visualizations, Mermaid diagram generation, Cascade suggestions, and enhanced Fast Context with SWE-grep powered subagent achieving 20x faster context retrieval at 2,800+ tokens per second.

community_feedback.quote: Users calling it 'an incredible feature' for codebase visualization
Described as 'meant to offer a shared understanding of a system between humans and AI'

title: December 17, 2025 Update with Session Management and Telemetry
description: Version 0.208.0 adds full automatic session management (no need to save sessions manually), along with code assist backend telemetry for tracking user accept/reject behavior on suggestions. The update includes the new Gemini 3 Flash model for faster performance at lower cost.

title: GPT-5.2-Codex Model and o3/o4-mini Reasoning Models
description: The Codex CLI and IDE Extension now default to gpt-5.2-codex for signed-in ChatGPT users. OpenAI also announced new o-series reasoning models including o3 and o4-mini, with GPT-5-codex introduced as a GPT-5 variant optimized for agentic coding. CLI updates include new /context command for token visualization and --resume flag.

title: Winter Launch Week 2025 and Enhanced File Access
description: Continue.dev shipped enhanced file access beyond workspace boundaries, improved agent error handling, CLI stability fixes, and celebrated Winter Launch Week 2025 on December 9, 2025. GitHub releases show verified commits from December 18, 2025, indicating active development on feature improvements.
